nodes.documentation:
@notice The heart of the recurring alarm clock.
         1. Check if the caller is the current alarm
         2. Execute the task
         3. Reschedule the alarm
         4. Cleanup

devdoc.author: Joseph Reed
devdoc.details: This contract's goal is to execute recurring tasks completely on-chain. It requires four main components:      1. A source for on chain alarms. This contract uses the Ethereum Alarm Clock (eac)      2. A payment delegate with this alarm scheduled and permitted to pull funds for each alarm      3. A funded delegated wallet with the payment delegate set as a delegate      4. A recurring task to execute

params._EAC: The Ethereum Alarm Clock smart contract responsible for creating decentralized alarms.
params._delegate: The delegate from which to pull alarm payments
params._wallet: The funding wallet, change address, and owner of the deployed alarms

params._limits: The execution limits applied to each decentralized alarm

devdoc.title: RecurringAlarmClock Contract

initialize(address,address,address).notice: Uses 'initialize()' instead of a constructor to make use of the clone          factory at https://github.com/optionality/clone-factory. In general, 'initialize()' should be           called directly following the alarm clock deployment through the use of a factory.
